member.name: ISyncMgrHandlerInfo.GetComment
member.summary: Gets a string that contains commentary regarding the handler.
member.param: When this method returns, contains a pointer to a buffer containing the comment string. This string is of maximum length MAX_SYNCMGR_NAME including the terminating null character.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise. If the method fails, ppszComment contains an empty string.

member.name: ISyncMgrHandlerInfo.GetLastSyncTime
member.summary: Gets the date and time when the handler was last synchronized.
member.param: When this method returns, contains a pointer to a structure containing the date and time information.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise. If the method fails, pftLastSync points to the value from the previous synchronization.

member.name: ISyncMgrHandlerInfo.GetType
member.summary: Gets the handler type for Sync Center.
member.param: When this method returns, points to a value from the enumeration that specifies the handler type. If the method fails, this parameter points to .
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise. If the method fails, pnType is set to .

member.name: ISyncMgrHandlerInfo.GetTypeLabel
member.summary: Gets a label for the handler type. This typically provides the model of the device or an equivalent handler-specific identity string.
member.param: When this method returns, contains a pointer to a buffer containing the label string.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise. If the method fails, ppszTypeLabel contains an empty string.

member.name: ISyncMgrHandlerInfo.IsActive
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the handler can be synchronized.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if the handler is active; otherwise, S_FALSE.

If the handler wants Sync Center to maintain the current state, it can return E_NOTIMPL. If any other value is returned, Sync Center sets the handler's state to the last known value. If the handler's last known value in that situation was inactive, Sync Center disables the Setup task. If the handler's last known value was active, the Delete task is not disabled.

If either the SYNCMGR_HCM_QUERY_BEFORE_ACTIVATE or SYNCMGR_HCM_QUERY_BEFORE_DEACTIVE flag is set in the mask returned from , the handler must manage its own activation state and therefore must return either S_OK or S_FALSE. Any other return value will be considered an error.

member.name: ISyncMgrHandlerInfo.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the handler—typically some type of external device—is connected.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if the handler is connected; otherwise, S_FALSE. An error returned by this method will be interpreted as S_OK.

member.name: ISyncMgrHandlerInfo.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the handler is enabled.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if the handler is enabled; otherwise, S_FALSE.

If the handler wants Sync Center to maintain the current state, it can return E_NOTIMPL. If any other value is returned, Sync Center sets the handler's enabled state to the last known value and enables or disables the associated tasks as appropriate.

If either the SYNCMGR_HCM_QUERY_BEFORE_ENABLE or SYNCMGR_HCM_QUERY_BEFORE_DISABLE flag is set in the mask returned from , the handler must manage its own enabled state and therefore must return either S_OK or S_FALSE. Any other return value will be considered an error.
